ORG.oclc.oai.server.catalog
Class RecordFactory

java.lang.Object
  ORG.oclc.oai.server.catalog.RecordFactory
Direct Known Subclasses:
ExtendedJDBCRecordFactory, FileRecordFactory, FolderRecordFactory, GettyFileRecordFactory, IMSXMLRecordFactory, JDBCRecordFactory, NewFileRecordFactory, NodeRecordFactory, XerSRURecordFactory, XMLFileRecordFactory, XMLRecordFactory
public abstract class RecordFactory
extends java.lang.Object

RecordFactory is responsible for pulling various pieces of information from native records such as the identifier, datestamp, and sets. Note that the Crosswalk implementations are responsible for the creating the <metadata> part of the response from native records.

Parameters:

getSchemaLocations

public java.util.Vector getSchemaLocations(java.lang.Object nativeItem)
                                    throws NoMetadataFormatsException
Get a list of supported schemaLocations for the specified native record.

Parameters:
nativeItem - native database record
Returns:
A Vector containing all the schemaLocations this record can support.
Throws:
NoMetadatdaFormatsException - This record doesn't support any of the available schemaLocations for this repository.
NoMetadataFormatsException

createHeader

public java.lang.String[] createHeader(java.lang.Object nativeItem)
                                throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
Convert a native "item" to a "record" String. Use this version of createHeader if the setSpecs are derived from the nativeItem itself.

Parameters:
nativeItem - the native record.
Returns:
String[0] = "header" XML string String[1] = oai-identifier.
Throws:
java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - One of the header components for this record is bad.

createHeader

public java.lang.String[] createHeader(java.lang.Object nativeItem,
                                       java.util.Iterator setSpecs)
                                throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
Convert a native "item" to a "record" String. Use this version of createHeader if the setSpecs are supplied from a source other than the nativeItem itself.

Parameters:
nativeItem - the native record.
setSpecs - a setSpec iterator
Returns:
String[0] = "header" XML string String[1] = oai-identifier.
Throws:
java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - One of the header components for this record is bad.

createHeader

public static java.lang.String[] createHeader(java.lang.String identifier,
                                              java.lang.String datestamp,
                                              java.util.Iterator setSpecs,
                                              boolean isDeleted)
                                       throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
Create a "record" string from the specified components.

Parameters:
identifier - the OAI identifier
datestamp - the datestamp
setSpecs -
isDeleted - a flag indicating the status of the record.
Returns:
String[0] = "header" XML string String[1] = oai-identifier.
Throws:
java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - One of the header components for this record is bad.

create

public java.lang.String create(java.lang.Object nativeItem,
                               java.lang.String schemaURL,
                               java.lang.String metadataPrefix)
                        throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException,
                               CannotDisseminateFormatException
Create the <record> for the given record and metadataFormat selection. Use this version of create if the setSpecs can be derived from the nativeItem itself.

Parameters:
nativeItem - the native record
schemaURL - the schemaURL desired for the response
metadataPrefix -
Returns:
a String containing the OAI record response.
Throws:
java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - One of the header components for this record is bad.
CannotDisseminateFormatException
This - nativeItem doesn't support the specified metadataPrefix

quickCreate

public abstract java.lang.String quickCreate(java.lang.Object nativeItem,
                                             java.lang.String schemaURL,
                                             java.lang.String metadataPrefix)
                                      throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException,
                                             CannotDisseminateFormatException
Allows classes that implement RecordFactory to override the default create() method. This is useful, for example, if the entire <record> is already packaged as the native record.

Parameters:
nativeItem - the native record
schemaURL - the schemaURL desired for the response
metadataPrefix -
Returns:
a String containing the OAI record response.
Throws:
java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - One of the header components for this record is bad.
CannotDisseminateFormatException
This - nativeItem doesn't support the specified metadataPrefix

                               CannotDisseminateFormatException
Convert a native "item" to a "record" object.

Parameters:
nativeItem - native "Item"
schemaURL - the schemaURL of the desired metadataFormat or NULL for a Record object containing all the supported Crosswalk(s)
Returns:
"record" String

getOAIIdentifier

public abstract java.lang.String getOAIIdentifier(java.lang.Object nativeItem)
Construct an OAI identifier from the native record Caveat: This brazenly assumes the record's local identifier exists somewhere within the native, or can be generated on the fly.

Parameters:
nativeItem - the native record
Returns:
String OAI identifier

getLocalIdentifier

public java.lang.String getLocalIdentifier(java.lang.Object nativeItem)
Extract the local identifier from the native record. Since I forgot to add this originally, it is a roundabout way to get this. It's a good idea to override this method to do it more directly.

Parameters:
nativeItem - the native record
Returns:
String local identifier

getDatestamp

public abstract java.lang.String getDatestamp(java.lang.Object nativeItem)
Construct an OAI datestamp from the native record Caveat: This brazenly assumes the record's datestamp exists somewhere within the native record, or can be generated on the fly.

Parameters:
nativeItem - the native record
Returns:
String OAI identifier

getSetSpecs

public abstract java.util.Iterator getSetSpecs(java.lang.Object nativeItem)
                                        throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
Get an Iterator containing all the setSpecs for this native record. Return null if the setSpecs are derived from a source other than the nativeItem itself. In this case, the AbstractCatalog is responsible for obtaining the setSpecs which can be passed to the create() and createHeader() methods along with the nativeItem.

Parameters:
nativeItem - the native record
Returns:
an Iterator containing setSpec String
Throws:
java.lang.IllegalArgumentException

isDeleted

public abstract boolean isDeleted(java.lang.Object nativeItem)
Get a boolean indicating if this native record is deleted

Parameters:
nativeItem - the native record
Returns:
true if record is deleted, false otherwise.

getAbouts

public abstract java.util.Iterator getAbouts(java.lang.Object nativeItem)
Get an Iterator containing all the <about> entries for this native record Return null if the abouts are derived from a source outside the native record itself. In this case, the AbstractCatalog is responsible for obtaining the abouts which can be passed to the create() method along with the nativeItem.

Parameters:
nativeItem - the native record
Returns:
an Iterator containing <about> XML String
